thread.title: Niagara County sets extra hours for absentee voting
thread.title_full: Niagara County sets extra hours for absentee voting - City & Region - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: Niagara County sets extra hours for absentee voting
text:
LOCKPORT – Those interested in casting an absentee ballot in Niagara County will have extra hours to do so on three days next week.
The county Board of Elections, 111 Main St., Lockport, which is normally open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. weekdays, will stay open until 7 p.m. on Oct. 26 and 28, and also will offer Saturday hours from 9 a.m. to noon Oct. 31, all for the purpose of distributing absentee ballots for the Nov. 3 election.
Ballots can be filled out on the spot or mailed in, but if the ballots are mailed, they must be postmarked by Nov. 2, the day before the election, or they won’t count.
